title: Magnetic force - square loops in magnetic field

content.question: Two square wire loops of different side lengths are moving at speed <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> into a constant magnetic field directed into the page, as shown. Both loops have the same resistance <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. Loop <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has side length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and Loop <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> has side length <math alttext="2 L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>L</mi></math>. What is the ratio of the net magnetic force on Loop <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> to the net magnetic force on Loop <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
